description: From Middle English adse, adese, from Old English adesa, eadesa, from Proto-Germanic *adisô, from Proto-Indo-European *h₃edʰḗs (compare Hittite [script needed] (atešša, “axe, hatchet”)).

entries.meaning: A cutting tool that has a curved blade set at a right angle to the handle and is used in shaping wood.

verbs.description: adze (third-person singular simple present adzes, present participle adzing, simple past and past participle adzed)

entries.meaning: To shape a material using an adze.
